sentences.sContent: It looks likely that the peace talks will fail.
sentences.sCn: 看来和平谈判可能会失败。

sentences.sContent: Millions of people have tried to quit smoking and failed miserably (= been completely unsuccessful ).
sentences.sCn: 数百万人戒过烟，都以惨败告终。

sentences.sContent: his efforts to save his failing marriage
sentences.sCn: 他挽救自己濒危婚姻的努力

sentences.sContent: If all else fails, you may be advised to have an operation.
sentences.sCn: 要是其他方法都不见效的话，恐怕你还是动手术的好。

exam.question: If you ______ in the exam, you will let your parents down.

answer.explain: 译文： 如果你考试不及格， 你的父母会很失望。 fall意为“落下； 倒下”， fail意为“不及格，　失败”。主句是将来时， if 引导的从句用一般现在时。

synos.tran: 失败，不及格；破产；缺乏；衰退
不及格；使失望；忘记；舍弃

words.tran: 失败，不成功（fail的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranCn: 失败，不及格；破产；缺乏；衰退
trans.tranOther: to not succeed in achieving something
an unsuccessful result in a test or examination
